title: How to Create a Set in Quizlet + Tips for Best Flashcards

steps.title: Open the Quizlet app.
steps.content: Open the Quizlet app. If you aren't already logged into your account, do so now, or create a new account. [1] X Research source You can use Quizlet to create flashcards online for effective studies . Quizlet is available for iOS in the App Store .

steps.title: Tap +.
steps.content: Tap + . This is at the bottom center of the app. A menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Flashcard set.
steps.content: Tap Flashcard set . This is the first option.

steps.title: Tap Create manually.
steps.content: Tap Create manually . This option allows you to manually enter the terms, definitions, and any other information. However, you can also select the following options to make uploading easier: Scan document : Scan images from your textbook or documents Select images : Upload images from your device to use with your cards Paste text : Copy and paste text from another source Select file : Upload a .pdf, .docx, or .pptx file to quickly transfer your text Keep in mind that some image options require a subscription to QuizletPlus.

steps.title: Enter a set title.
steps.content: Enter a set title. This goes into the field at the top. For example, you can name your set as the subject, chapter, or unit you're studying. If you want to add a description, tap + Description underneath the field.

steps.title: Enter a term and definition.
steps.content: Enter a term and definition. Each card will have these two fields: Term and Definition . If you're creating a vocabulary set, the word will go in the first field and the definition will go in the second. Repeat this step until you've entered all your terms and definitions. If you need to create more cards for the set, tap the + icon at the bottom. To delete a card, swipe left on it and tap the trash can icon.

steps.title: Tap the checkmark icon when you're finished.
steps.content: Tap the checkmark icon when you're finished. This will create the flashcard set. Your flashcard set will be made public by default. If you want to adjust your privacy settings, tap the cog icon first. Select Visible to and select People with a password or Just me . Tap Done . You can find your completed set on your homepage underneath the Sets header or in the Library tab. Need help making your Quizlet sets as helpful as possible? Jump down to our tips for making effective sets .

steps.title: Sign in to https://quizlet.com/.
steps.content: Sign in to https://quizlet.com/ . Click Log In in the top-right corner to enter your email address or username and password. If you don't already have an account, click Sign up for free to create one now.

steps.title: Click +.
steps.content: Click + . You can find this in the top-right corner. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Click Flashcard set.
steps.content: Click Flashcard set . This is the first option. By default, you'll need to enter terms and definitions yourself. If you want to create cards automatically using existing data, click Import or Create from notes below the description field instead.

steps.title: Enter a set title.
steps.content: Enter a set title. This goes into the field at the top. For example, you can name your set as the subject, chapter, or unit you're studying. If you want to add a description, enter it in the Add a descriptionâ€¦ field below the title.

steps.title: Enter a term and definition.
steps.content: Enter a term and definition. Each card will have these two fields: Term and Definition . If you're creating a vocabulary set, the word will go in the first field and the definition will go in the second. Repeat this step until you've entered all your terms and definitions. If you need to create more cards for the set, click Add a card at the bottom. If you want to import data instead, click + Import underneath the description. Copy and paste your data into the box, and then click Import . To delete a card, click the trashcan icon at the top-right corner of the card.

steps.title: Click Create when you're finished.
steps.content: Click Create when you're finished. This will create the flashcard set. Your flashcard set will be made public by default. If you want to adjust your privacy settings, click the cog icon first. Click the Visible to drop-down menu and select People with a password or Just me . Click Save . You can find your completed set on your homepage under Recents or in the Your library tab on the left.

steps.title: Utilize existing sets.
steps.content: Utilize existing sets. Quizlet sets are shared publicly by default. If you're studying a common subject, it's likely that another user has already created a set with similar terms. Before creating your set, use the search option on your homepage to find existing flashcards and study guides. Once you find a similar set, you can choose to customize it to add terms of your own or delete terms you don't need. Just tap the three-dots icon next to the set title and select Customize .

steps.title: Import terms to save time.
steps.content: Import terms to save time. If you have a long list of terms you need to add, select the Import option to quickly copy data from another source, such as a Microsoft Word document or Google Docs document, and paste it into Quizlet. Quizlet will automatically separate the terms and definitions, and create the set for you. Before pasting, be sure the data follows a consistent format. If you have mixed formatting, your set may be imported incorrectly.

steps.title: Scan your documents.
steps.content: Scan your documents. If you tend to handwrite your notes rather than type them, you can opt to upload a picture of your notes to use as your flashcard. Select the Scan document option to get started.

steps.title: Combine small sets together.
steps.content: Combine small sets together. If you have a final test coming up, you can combine sets from previous units into one large set to test your knowledge of the entire course or semester. Rather than creating a whole new set with all existing terms, just combine them! To combine sets, click the three-dots icon next to a set and select Combine . Select the set(s) you want to combine, and then create the new set.

steps.title: Use images.
steps.content: Use images. While you need a QuizletPlus subscription to upload your own images, you can use Quizlet's image library for free. If you're a visual learner, adding images can help you memorize your terms more quickly. To use Quizlet's image gallery, select the image icon next to the flash card in Edit mode.

steps.title: Use the correct language for your set.
steps.content: Use the correct language for your set. If you're creating a set to study a different language, you can select a language for your set. As you type a term, select Language or Choose Language underneath the field, and then select a language.

steps.title: Why can't I create flashcards manually?
steps.content: Why can't I create flashcards manually? If you can't create any flashcards on Quizlet, try checking your internet connection. It may be a loading issue with the server. If your internet is fine, try using Quizlet on another platform, such as the mobile app, if you're using the website. You can also try logging in and out of your Quizlet account.

steps.title: Does Quizlet have a term limit?
steps.content: Does Quizlet have a term limit? You can have up to 2000 terms in a single set. If you need to add more terms, you can create a new set and keep them together within a folder.

steps.title: How do you make Quizlets private?
steps.content: How do you make Quizlets private? To make Quizlet sets private, select your set. Select the cog icon, and then select Visible to . Select Just me or People with a password .

steps.title: Can you combine study sets on Quizlet?
steps.content: Can you combine study sets on Quizlet? You can add a set to another set in Quizlet by selecting the three-dots menu icon, and then selecting Combine . Select the set(s) you want to add together, and then create the new set.
